sen.j: 菖蒲湯（しょうぶゆ）とは5月5日の端午の節句の日に、ショウブの根や葉を入れて沸かす風呂のことである。
sen.e: Shobuyu is the bathwater heated with iris roots and leaves in it on Tango no Sekku (Boys' Day) of May 5.
Shobuyu is the bathwater heated with iris roots and leaves in it on Tango no Sekku (Boys' Day) of May 5.
Shobuyu is the bathwater heated with iris roots and leaves in it on Tango no Sekku (Boys' Day) of May 5.

sen.j: 入浴することで、邪気を払うとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that by taking the bath evil sprits can be driven away.
It is believed that by taking the bath evil spirits can be driven away.
It is believed that by taking the bath evil spirits can be driven away.

sen.j: ショウブは「勝負」や「尚武」につながるともいうが、元来は薬草である。
sen.e: Although shobu (iris) leads to shobu (win or lose) and shobu (martial spirits), it is originally a medical herb.
Although shobu (iris) is linked to 'shobu' (win or lose) and 'shobu' (martial spirits), it is originally a medical herb.
sen.cmt: leads→is linked,クォーツを挿入しました。
sen.e: Although shobu (iris) is linked to 'shobu' (win or lose) and 'shobu' (martial spirits), it is originally a medical herb.

sen.j: 「服薬」の語があるように薬草には呪術的意味があり、身におびるとよいとされた。
sen.e: It is believed that medical herbs have occult sense and wearing them is good for health as the saying 'fukuyaku (taking medicine), which literally means 'to wear medicine.,' implies.
It is believed that medical herbs have a magical sense and wearing them is good for health as the saying 'fukuyaku' (taking medicine).
sen.cmt: have occult sense→have a magical sense,クォーツを修正しました。 which literally means 'to wear medicine.,' implies の部分を削除しました。
sen.e: It is believed that medical herbs have a magical sense and wearing them is good for health as the saying 'fukuyaku' (taking medicine).

sen.j: アイ (植物)・アカネ・キハダ (植物)などの染料はほとんどが薬草である。
sen.e: Most of the dyes such as ai (indigo plant), akane (madder) and kihada (Amur cork tree) are also medical herbs.
Most of the dyes such as ai (indigo plant), akane (madder) and kihada (Amur cork tree) are medical herbs.
Most of the dyes such as ai (indigo plant), akane (madder) and kihada (Amur cork tree) are medical herbs.

sen.j: したがって菖蒲湯は薬草を入れた温水浴としての民間医療行為としての意味がある。
sen.e: Therefore, shobuyu means taking a hot bath with medical herb as a folk remedy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, shobuyu means taking a hot bath with a medical herb as a folk remedy.
sen.cmt: a medical herb と修正しました。
sen.e: Therefore, shobuyu means taking a hot bath with a medical herb as a folk remedy.

sen.j: これが年中行事と結びついた例といえる。
sen.e: And it is an example that a folk remedy came to combine with annual event.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And it is an example as that a folk remedy came to be tied up with an annual event.
sen.cmt: combine→be tied up,example→example as,annual→an annual と修正しました。
sen.e: And it is an example as that a folk remedy came to be tied up with an annual event.

sen.j: 同様の例として、冬至の日の柚子湯がある。
sen.e: One of the similar example is yuzuyu (a hot citron bath) on winter solstice.

sen.j: なお、菖蒲湯は夏の季語となっている。
sen.e: In addition, shobuyu is one of the kigo (season word for haiku, Japanese seventeen-syllable poem) in summer.
In addition, shobuyu is a kigo (season word for haiku, Japanese 17 syllable poem) for summer.
sen.cmt: one of the→a,seventeen-syllable→17 syllable と修正しました。in summer→for summer と修正しました。
